channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Top end of Townley Road rubbish, 22nd August
item.description:
At the top end of Townley Road just passed the funeral directors opposite Nat West Bank there is rubbish strewn all over the pavement and is encouraging vermin. Please can this be cleared asap as it looks a mess.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Royal Oak Road, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping of a fridge freezer, 22nd August
item.description:
I live in Groombridge Close and in the corner of my Close is an open space where I take my dog for a run about. The path leading to the gate is obstructed by my neighbour who lives a few doors along dumping it as I saw her moving it down the road. Also the field looks like it hasn't been cut for awhile and as we pay a service charge wondered why this hasn't been done, there could be all sort of sharp objects and never know what she could step on. Can you get someone out to take the obstruction away and also get the grass cut and bushes leading into the open space please.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Groombridge Close, Blackfen, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Illegal parking on path, 22nd August
item.description:
A broken bollard at Bridges House entrance SE5 7QL mean vans keep taking advantage to enter the estate and park on the pedestrian path. It's dangerous. Bollard needs replacing.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Picton Street, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Updates dear sir madam thanks for your report in regards to car parked illegally in your bay. This is criminal activity and anti-social behavior taking place at this location your authority Hackney Council/police are aware of this situation but allow it to happen because they are incompetent or short staffed. The tenant, Irish traveller male of 33 & 35 Merriam Ave, London E9 5NA connected properties related/regular clones number plates on vehicles.Hiding cars true identities, evade parking tickets, evade police AMPR detection, Cloning stolen vehicles. Vehicles no MOT, no insurance, no tax, Criminal behaviour is going on in a large scale group operating in the Hackney Wick ,Trowbridge estate area. The metropolitan police commissioner only can afford to put one CCTV camera up near Merriam Ave garages.metropolitan police commissioner displacing antisocial behavior to another neighborhood. This has been going on for many years stolen vehicles every day.Vehicle parking without permit in a space that does not belong to them Reported via mobile in the Illegal Parking category anonymously at 18:09, Wednesday 30 July 2025 Sent to Hackney Council less than a minute later. FixMyStreet ref: 7956384. Photo of this reportzoom This vehicle has been parking in the space M244 which does not belong to them, and without a permit. They ignored notes asking for them to move the vehicle. The owner of the vehicle has been seen leaving 35 Merriam Avenue., 22nd August
item.description:
Antisocial behaviour/criminal activity at this location. Hackney Council authority need to work alongside the metropolitan safer neighborhood teams. This is not fair on residence.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Merriam Avenue, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 17 - Maitland Racing, 22nd August
item.description:

item.title: Camlan Road (BR1 5LT) has been overgrown with weeds and grass running along the kerbs and gullies from the top to the bottom of the road for years, 22nd August
item.description:
Camlan Road (BR1 5LT) has been overgrown with weeds and grass running along the kerbs and gullies from the top to the bottom of the road for years, preventing proper drainage and creating surface water and flooding risks at the bottom of the incline.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Camlan Road, Downham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree between 13 & 14 Well Rd, 22nd August
item.description:
The tree is leaning way over towards the homes and the overgrowth is now touching 14 Well Rd’s roof. It looks like the tree can fall down soon. Please trim the tree to stop touching the house and to remove the weight towards and over the house. Maybe trim back some large branches? Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 13, Well Road, Belsize Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet
